name: ultraviolet lamp production, for water desinfection | ultraviolet lamp | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/11204/documentation

This datasets represents production of 1 ultraviolet lamp for water treatment. Material inputs have been measured from real lamp autopsy. This dataset is a proxy and only includes materials. Energy requirements, wastes and other materials needed for the lamp fabrication have been excluded due to lack of data.

From raw and semi-fabricated materials used in ultraviolet lamp production.

This dataset ends with production of one ultraviolet lamp. It includes material inputs only. It excludes forming of materials, energy inputs for production and assembly, water consumption, wastes and emissions to environment that could occur during fabrication of the lamp.
category: C:Manufacturing/27:Manufacture of electrical equipment/274:Manufacture of electric lighting equipment/2740:Manufacture of electric lighting equipment

processDocumentation.timeDescription: Arbitrary time period chosen for the proxy.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: One lamp measured extrapolated to all types of ultraviolet lamps used for water treatment.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: Weight measurements of parts from one ultraviolet lamp autopsy.

exchanges.description:
Calculated value. Measured quartz sleve containing small metal pieces and mercury. Literature based mercury content was substrated from measured weight. Silica sand is assumed to be equivalent to quartz.

Borchers, H., Fuller, A., & Malley, J. P. (2008). Assessing the Risk of Mercury in Drinking Water after UV Lamp Breaks. NE-WTTAC, report, 8p.
